mainTitle: Data Rights in E-Commerce & Self-Assessment Checklist
mainParagraph: Data Rights in E-Commerce empower individuals to control how their data is collected, used, stored, and shared, ensuring a lawful basis for data collection, secure processing, purpose limitation, and protection during data transfers. The Self-Assessment Checklist helps organizations ensure compliance with data protection laws by listing categories of personal data, identifying data sources, documenting legal bases for processing, and defining retention periods.
dataRightsParagraph: Data rights empower individuals to control how their data is collected, used, stored, and shared.

keyAspects.title: Data Collection:
keyAspects.description: Ensure lawful basis for collecting data.

keyAspects.title: Purpose Limitation:
keyAspects.description: Use data only for specified purposes.

keyAspects.title: Data Subject Rights:
keyAspects.description: Uphold rights like access, rectification, and erasure.

keyAspects.title: Data Breach Notification:
keyAspects.description: Report breaches to authorities and individuals.

keyAspects.title: Privacy Policies:
keyAspects.description: Provide clear information about data usage.

challengesParagraph: Complexity of requests, data accuracy, technical limitations, balancing interests.
